content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

The passage:
The fundaments of human dignity, autonomous decision-making, and democracies are shaking, but I believe that they need to be vigorously defended, as they are not only core principles of livable societies, but also the basis of greater efficiency and success.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the text are "the fundaments of human dignity, autonomous decision-making, and democracies are shaking" and "the basis of greater efficiency and success." These phrases contain abstract concepts and complex vocabulary that contribute to the overall complexity of the passage.

The complexity level of the passage is approximately 8.5 out of 10, with a Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level of 9.5. This suggests that the passage is written at a fairly advanced level and may be challenging for a university student to understand.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium) contraint. Only provide the identified section
the fundaments of human dignity, autonomous decision-making, and democracies are shaking
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
These core values of human dignity and democracy are under threat.
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage

The fundaments of human dignity, autonomous decision-making, and democracies are shaking, but I believe that they need to be vigorously defended, as they are not only core principles of livable societies, but also the basis of greater efficiency and success.

The simplified section "the fundaments of human dignity, autonomous decision-making, and democracies are shaking" has been replaced with "These core values of human dignity and democracy are under threat".

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The updated passage loses the nuance of "the fundaments" and "autonomous decision-making" compared to the original passage. The severity of this information loss is Medium to High, as it removes specific details that contribute to the original meaning. Additionally, the original passage mentions "livable societies" which is replaced with a more general term in the simplified version, resulting in a further loss of information. The severity of this loss is Low to Medium. Overall, the updated passage loses some of the original's precision and detail.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

High

No
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex part of the text is "not only core principles of livable societies, but also the basis of greater efficiency and success." This phrase contains abstract vocabulary and a complex structure that contributes to its complexity.

The complexity level of the passage is approximately 6.5 out of 10, with a Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level of 7.5. This suggests that the passage is now more accessible to a university student.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Print the final version of the simplified passage, include only the text of the passage with no comments or additional punctuation, and do not provide the original passage

These core values of human dignity and democracy are under threat, but I believe that they need to be vigorously defended, as they are not only core principles of livable societies, but also the basis of greater efficiency and success.
